carousel_items: For the first week, avoid activities that require you to be alert.
Can cause dizziness, drowsiness, and salivation.
Report any confusion or inability to control muscle movements to your doctor.
Not safe to use with alcohol.

basics.benefits_moa: Clonazepam is a fast-acting benzodiazepine. It affects neurotransmitters in the brain and calms the nervous system. This reduces anxiety and muscle spasms, and causes sleepiness.
basics.bottom_line: Clonazepam is okay for occasional or short-term use (up to 4 weeks) for anxiety, and to treat seizures. Less severe withdrawal symptoms compared to similar drugs.
downsides: Can cause memory problems, drowsiness, dizziness, and confusion.
Can be habit-forming, so it's not typically used for long-term treatment, or for people who've had problems with drug or alcohol abuse.
Most people find that it gets less effective over time.

downsides_processed.orig: Can cause memory problems, drowsiness, dizziness, and confusion.
Can be habit-forming, so it's not typically used for long-term treatment, or for people who've had problems with drug or alcohol abuse.
Most people find that it gets less effective over time.

upsides: Effective at relieving short-term anxiety and sleeplessness.
Can be used together with antidepressants to manage anxiety disorders. Especially helpful for anxiety symptoms while you wait for an antidepressant to kick in (it can take several weeks).
Can be used alone or with other medicines to treat seizures.
Less severe withdrawal symptoms compared to other benzodiazepines.

upsides_processed.orig: Effective at relieving short-term anxiety and sleeplessness.
Can be used together with antidepressants to manage anxiety disorders. Especially helpful for anxiety symptoms while you wait for an antidepressant to kick in (it can take several weeks).
Can be used alone or with other medicines to treat seizures.
Less severe withdrawal symptoms compared to other benzodiazepines.

drugs.one_liner: Controls seizures and helps you relax.

userStories.tip: It made me very sleepy and relaxed when I first took it but it relieved anxious feelings on the spot. Works way better than Xanax for me.. Plus it lasts longer

userStories.identifier: School student with panic and bipolar
userStories.tip: Klonopin has effectively eliminated panic from my life. I still have obsessive thoughts, but I'm aware of them and can file them to the back of my mind. Using it for more than a few weeks though has caused me to experience withdrawal.

userStories.identifier: I have approx 8 diff kinds of arthritisr
userStories.tip: heat & weight help a little such as 7-8 blankets

Tbh, I used Klonopin for benzo withdrawal. I was hooked on Xanax for about a year taking up to 6mg daily. So I went to my pshyc doctor and shared my problem. She Rx'd me Klonopin to taper off. Now I'm 100% benzo free!
First week may cause tiredness and/or fatigue. After 5-7 days if consecutive use (2-3 times a day) this will subside substantially.

Klonopin caused extreme anxiety, panic attacks, violence, increased suicide attempts to escape adverse reactions, alcohol use, caused agoraphobia. Withdrawals almost killed me. Very dangerous drug. Highly addicting.

Very good medication. Xanax makes me feel 'druggy'... Valium is also good, but seems a little less potent than Klonopin. Klonopin imo, is right in between Xanax and Valium. Klonopin is the best benzodiazepine.
Don't drink.

I take three one mg a day, I was plagued with anxiety from age 10, I was a mess and took tranzine for years, then xanax which I took way to much, had high tolerance fast, was hell coming off, started 3 1mg , hard coming off but I'm a lifer

Klonopin is a medication that one uses on a regular basis to keep anxiety or manic phases at bay.  It can take up to an hour to feel its effects and when first starting, it takes a few days to really become effective.

userStories.identifier: Social Anxiety w/SS on Autism spectrum
userStories.tip: It took me a long time to realize that I experienced long term memory loss related to taking clonazepam.  Clonazepam reduces my IQ by about 10 points.  It reduces my ability to think and learn.

userStories.identifier: Field Technican, 52 years old with GAD
userStories.tip: Take as needed to avoid tolerance.
Took v low dose.  Saw no side effects and it helped quiet the teeth grinding and tightness in my stomach
Once you're on it at a daily dose, for more than 2 months, going off will be very very difficult. Google "Clonazepam" withdrawl.

I used it to get back to sleep when I woke u at 4 am, which was regularly. I also used it for high intensity moments which triggered anxiety. Careful not to go over 1.5 mg a day; it is a bit insidious in how the dosage creeps up.
Not for sudden anxiety attacks, but can help keep a baseline to prevent both my panic attacks and control mania with bipolar disorder.
userStories.identifier: Dx w/ Bipolar Type 1 and ADHD.

userStories.tip: If taking 2 or 3 times daily, make sure to take them at the timed intervals (every 6 hours, every 12 hours, etc.). Missing these time frames by more than two hours can really effect you and you don't physically feel it 'wear off'.

Actually began taking this for KNOTS in tummy and IBS. Worked off the bat. Been on it for 20 years and keeps me able to work and socialize. DON"T run out or quit, the withdrawals are horrible, worse than most Pain Pills, I know, been there.
Works great for staying asleep, but its impossible to stop taking it once you're hooked.  Very addictive
It takes a bit to kick in, so it works best as a now-and-then pill for when you're going to be in a situation you know makes you anxious.
Take it in the evening before you go to sleep, it keeps you even throughout the next day. Make sure to not take it too late, otherwise drowsiness can occur in the AM

Warning! Although Klonopin and other benzos work well to relax you, they cause PHYSICAL dependence. I was on a low dose (1 mg) and it took me a year to get off of it. A BMJ article (9/2014) says that benzo use causes dementia. Stay away!
userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping

userStories.identifier: Laid back with type A moments
userStories.tip: It works great for me although it is definitely addictive.  Many sources report that you need to take higher dosages for the same effect over time, but that has not been the case with me.  I love what this medication does for me.

It worked for a few months and then turned on me. Caused more symptoms and the ones it was meant to prevent came back worse than ever.  It took over two years to taper even though the doc said I could quit in a few weeks.  Off five months and still not healed yet.  Look up benzo withdrawal syndrome on Wiki.  If I helped one person I feel good.  This is POISON!
userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping

userStories.tip: If you are taking it long-term, try to take as low a dose as possible. Withdrawl after long-term use is extremely unpleasant.
userStories.identifier: Parent, works in software, wife/2 kids

userStories.tip: Obviously, a fast acting benzo is going to be "overall worth it". It stops the panic. It stops the bodily sensations of oncoming panic attacks. It makes life bearable after being traumatized.
Dosage and timing is everything with Clonazepam.  Start off at 1 mg and evaluate from there. Also take at least and 90 minutes before you need it to start working.
userStories.identifier: Easy going and a team player.

drugs.name: Klonopin

carousel_items_processed.orig: For the first week, avoid activities that require you to be alert.
Can cause dizziness, drowsiness, and salivation.
Report any confusion or inability to control muscle movements to your doctor.
Not safe to use with alcohol.

risks_warnings.title: Tolerance and dependence
risks_warnings.description: If you use Clonazepam for 4 weeks or more, it's likely that your body will develop tolerance to it, which means that more and more of the medication is needed to achieve the same effect. You're also likely to become physically dependent on the medication, which means that you'll feel withdrawal symptoms if you stop taking it all at once. You can avoid withdrawal by weaning off of the medication very slowly with the help of a doctor. Take only the prescribed dose to minimize risks of abuse and overdose. Clonazepam should not be used by people with a history of drug abuse if an alternative medication is available.
risk_factors: Taking more than the prescribed dose

description_processed.orig: If you use Clonazepam for 4 weeks or more, it's likely that your body will develop tolerance to it, which means that more and more of the medication is needed to achieve the same effect. You're also likely to become physically dependent on the medication, which means that you'll feel withdrawal symptoms if you stop taking it all at once. You can avoid withdrawal by weaning off of the medication very slowly with the help of a doctor. Take only the prescribed dose to minimize risks of abuse and overdose. Clonazepam should not be used by people with a history of drug abuse if an alternative medication is available.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Clonazepam suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and muscle pain or burning. Withdrawal symptoms can last 6 weeks or longer. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose when stopping or switching to a different medication.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Clonazepam suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and muscle pain or burning. Withdrawal symptoms can last 6 weeks or longer. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose when stopping or switching to a different medication.

risks_warnings.title: Pregnancy
risks_warnings.description: Clonazepam can harm a developing fetus. The baby can become dependent on the medicine and go through withdrawal after birth. Don't use Clonazepam while pregnant.

description_processed.orig: Clonazepam can harm a developing fetus. The baby can become dependent on the medicine and go through withdrawal after birth. Don't use Clonazepam while pregnant.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Clonazepam impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. These effects can extend to the morning after taking Clonazepam. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Clonazepam impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. These effects can extend to the morning after taking Clonazepam. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Memory problems
risks_warnings.description: Your brain may have difficulty making new memories while you're taking Clonazepam.

description_processed.orig: Your brain may have difficulty making new memories while you're taking Clonazepam.
